content: The \l is producing ⇇ in my Emacs. How to fix it? I was expecting ← !!
Use vi! Oh no, sorry. Use VScode. We really need that Lean4 extension for vi in order to settle this once and for all.

If you write \l you probably get a list of options in the minibuffer. Select the one you want (which is probably the first one). After that, Emacs will choose that character whenever you write \l again.
Thank you, I didn't notice the minibuffer @Floris van Doorn !
